SECTION.SUBTITLE: General information about data protection and purpose of storage

What data is collected?
Booking When you make a reservation booked through HRS, we collect the necessary arrangements for the reservation information from you, particularly your name, your telephone number, your e-mail address ("Contact") and the date of your arrival and departure, your hotel and type of room booked ("reservation data").
Contact About the Contact field can report general inquiries. To address these requests, we collect your contact information. After processing your request we will delete that data.
MyHRS Under MyHRS you can register as a user of our site with your contact information. This registration has among others the advantage that you do not have to retype your data anew for each booking. You have the option to terminate the registration at any time, by sending an email to:
datenschutz@hrs.de
We will then delete your contact information. Under MyHRS You also have the option to e-mail about travel tips, new features on the site, special offers, etc. to be kept up to date. You can also subscribe to a newsletter. It is up to you, this kind of customer care to choose and at any time to stop again.
Connection information in the course of using the website of the HRS in this communication transmitted and accumulated usage data are collected such as IP address. We use the resulting usage data only for the prevention of abuse and interference as well as to optimize our range.

SECTION.SUBTITLE: Privacy Statement
SECTION.SUBTEXT:
How secure is the data transfer to HRS?
All data that you provide to HRS available are encrypted with at least 128 bit SSL (Secure Socket Layer) method and transmitted. Unless your browser supports stronger encryption, the data with up to 256-bit encrypted. When SSL is a proven and world related encryption system, which allows your browser automatically encrypt your data before returning it to us.
How secure is my data on the HRS database?
For our database and our web server, we use high HRS safety standards in order to ensure effective protection against the loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and deletion of your data.

SECTION.SUBTITLE: Cookies
SECTION.SUBTEXT:
Cookies - What are they?
Cookies are small data files that are stored by your browser on the hard drive of your computer. They simplify your booking by, frequently accessed data are displayed automatically for you at a repeat visit our websites. You can set your browser to not store any cookies on your computer. You might be able then but some features of our range not perceive. The basic functions "Search & Book" however, are also possible without cookies.
